trans-unit.source: The following steps create a new mobile service in Azure and add code to your project that connects your app to this new service.
trans-unit.target: The following steps create a new mobile service in Azure and add code to your project that connects your app to this new service.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013 connects to Azure on your behalf to create the new mobile service by using the credentials that you provide.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013 connects to Azure on your behalf to create the new mobile service by using the credentials that you provide.

trans-unit.source: When you create a new mobile service, you must specify an Azure SQL Database that is used by the mobile service to store app data.
trans-unit.target: When you create a new mobile service, you must specify an Azure SQL Database that is used by the mobile service to store app data.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio 2013, open Solution Explorer, right-click the Windows Store app project, click **Add**, and then click **Connected Service...**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio 2013, open Solution Explorer, right-click the Windows Store app project, click **Add**, and then click **Connected Service...**.

trans-unit.source: In the Services Manager dialog, click **Create service...**, then select **<Manage...>** from **Subscription** in the Create Mobile Service dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Services Manager dialog, click **Create service...**, then select **<Manage...>** from **Subscription** in the Create Mobile Service dialog.

trans-unit.source: create service manage subscriptions
trans-unit.target: create service manage subscriptions

trans-unit.source: In Manage Microsoft Azure Subscriptions, click **Sign In...** to sign in to your Azure account (if required), select an available subscription, then click **Close**.
trans-unit.target: In Manage Microsoft Azure Subscriptions, click **Sign In...** to sign in to your Azure account (if required), select an available subscription, then click **Close**.

trans-unit.source: When your subscription already has one or more existing mobile services, the service names are displayed.
trans-unit.target: When your subscription already has one or more existing mobile services, the service names are displayed.

trans-unit.source: Back in the **Create Mobile Service** dialog, select your **Subscription**, the **.NET Framework** backend in **Runtime** and a **Region** for your mobile service, then type a **Name** for your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Back in the **Create Mobile Service** dialog, select your **Subscription**, the **.NET Framework** backend in **Runtime** and a **Region** for your mobile service, then type a **Name** for your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]Mobile service names must be unique.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]Mobile service names must be unique.

trans-unit.source: A red X is displayed next to **Name** when the name you supplied is not available.
trans-unit.target: A red X is displayed next to **Name** when the name you supplied is not available.

trans-unit.source: In **Database**, select **<Create a free SQL Database>**, supply the **Server user name**, **Server password**, and **Server password confirmation** then click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: In **Database**, select **<Create a free SQL Database>**, supply the **Server user name**, **Server password**, and **Server password confirmation** then click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: create new mobile service in VS 2013
trans-unit.target: create new mobile service in VS 2013

trans-unit.source: As part of this tutorial, you create a new free SQL Database instance and server.
trans-unit.target: As part of this tutorial, you create a new free SQL Database instance and server.

trans-unit.source: You can reuse this new database and administer it as you would any other SQL Database instance.
trans-unit.target: You can reuse this new database and administer it as you would any other SQL Database instance.

trans-unit.source: You can only have one free database instance.
trans-unit.target: You can only have one free database instance.

trans-unit.source: If you already have a database in the same region as the new mobile service, you can instead choose the existing database.
trans-unit.target: If you already have a database in the same region as the new mobile service, you can instead choose the existing database.

trans-unit.source: When you choose an existing database, make sure that you supply correct login credentials.
trans-unit.target: When you choose an existing database, make sure that you supply correct login credentials.

trans-unit.source: If you supply incorrect login credentials, the mobile service is created in an unhealthy state.
trans-unit.target: If you supply incorrect login credentials, the mobile service is created in an unhealthy state.

trans-unit.source: After the mobile service is created, select the newly created mobile service from the list in Service Manager and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: After the mobile service is created, select the newly created mobile service from the list in Service Manager and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: After the wizard completes, the mobile service project is added to your solution, the required NuGet packages are installed, a reference to the Mobile Services client library is added to the project, and your project source code is updated.
trans-unit.target: After the wizard completes, the mobile service project is added to your solution, the required NuGet packages are installed, a reference to the Mobile Services client library is added to the project, and your project source code is updated.
